data.title: Great Stay
data.text: Awesome place to stay.  Could not ask for anything better.  Will definitely being staying here again.  The staff bend over backwards to help assist you and the facilities were very clean.  The breakfast the next morning was great.

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review of our hotel, we appreciate your feedback.  I am so glad you enjoyed your most recent visit with us and have shared with our staff your comments as they take pride in hearing that they did a great job!  We look forward to having you as our guest again in the future when traveling to the Bowling Green area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Relaxed and chilled out..
data.text: Huge room, nice surrounding, swimming pool, gym and kind of forest or Park behind the hotel.. Lot of restaurants around to pick on what kind of food you want to eat.. Krogers is near by for daily needs and beers.. Most importantly nice staff at front desk and nice complementary breakfast with dinner sometimes..

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel.  We pride ourselves on providing great service and are so glad you enjoyed your most recent visit at the Staybridge Suites.  I hope you were able to enjoy some of our great dining options as well that are located around the hotel as you mentioned.  We look forward to having you again in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hotel, convenient and spacious!
data.text: Stayed 3 nights for my son's state golf tournament.  It's a fairly new hotel and is similar to Homewood.  It seems geared to those staying 7 or more nights for business but is also great for those who desire space! The kitchen in the room was very modern, the living room comfortable with an L shaped couch.  The bathroom was inside the area with the bedroom and the door to the bedroom was folding.  The bathroom was modern with a separate closet/vanity area separated by a door from the toilet/bathtub-shower.  The bedroom was spacious with nice, comfortable beds.  All the appliances and televisions were modern too.  There was a nice counter with bar stools between the kitchen and living area.  The lobby and eating area were very nice and there was the usual breakfast fare with evening food provided Monday-Wednesday.  I'd rate below Homewood and Embassy Suites but certainly wouldn't hesitate to recommend this great hotel.  There are several restaurants, etc around and it's convenient to the bypass so that you can navigate about any part of Bowling Green from there.

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your great review of our property we appreciate your feedback.  I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay during your son's golf tournament.  We look forward to having you again as our guest in the future, or possibly again next year for the tournament.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Magnificent
data.text:
Staybridge suites never disappoints! We were in town for our 4th grade son's football team to go to West Kentucky University game and be able to go out on the field with the players. My husband,  son, and I, stayed in the two-bedroom Suite with a pull out couch with another family.
When we arrived to the hotel we were about 20 minutes early, but it did not because guest services got to work and merely to check the sent. soon as you walk in the hotel gives off that homie and clean nature. There is refreshments that are complementary at check-in for you to take advantage of while you wait at the front desk which we did not have to wait but still took advantage of the refreshments. As we got up to our room it was spectacularly clean no dust no mold no cracks I was immediately relieved. Now mind you I am a germophobe and no matter what I carry my alcohol and disinfectant spray. I go in and check the hotel rooms before anyone who's with me comes in the hotel, and I spray all my spray. I did not feel the need to go overboard when spraying my chemicals. Now the first room did not have the pull out bed as we had book. So call down to the desk to find out why we were not getting the room that was booked. Now I was told they only had one room with the two bedroom suite with a couch that pulled out. We were offered this but in my mind I was thinking why didn't we get that world since that is what we booked in the first place. My husband and I guess was that the room was not all the way ready yet. So immediately I returned to the front desk to get the keys to the room that was right down the hall that met all our requirements. The fact that we was not given this room at first bothered me but it did not take away from my stay. The outside pool was wonderful to take advantage of but the coloring was massive so be aware because the children and I had burning eyes almost immediately. The pool was open until 11 p.m. which was great because it allowed us to go and explore Mammoth Cave and come back and still let the children swim. Location was amazing as this hotel is around all different restaurants diagonal from Kroger's and ten minutes from the college. So I rate this top notch minus the small little glitches! Definitely would stay here again and I hope that you get to visit soon too.

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your most recent stay with us.  Sounds like we were a great fit for you and your family while visiting Bowling Green.  We look forward to having you as our guests again in the future when visiting the area.  I hope you enjoyed mammoth cave and the WKU game as well.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great accommodations!
data.text: I came to Bowling Green to see some family whom I haven't seen in a long time.  They were staying at your hotel because they like it & you are pet-friendly. I loved that about your hotel, even though I didn't have a pet with me.  The room was fantastic!   The only issue I had was with the bathroom sink draining VERY SLOWLY!  I did report that to the front desk.  Breakfast was very good also.  I was there only one night, but would happily stay there again in the future!

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your great review of our property.  We are so glad that we were able to provide a great place for you and your family to visit.  Thank you for the feedback regarding the sink, we appreciate all opportunities to improve our guest experience.  We look forward to having you back in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place to spend time with family and friends.
data.text: Great place to relax and spend time. We stay here after my son's football games and it allows us to be together but have private sleeping areas as well. The units are equipped well and very comfortable.

data.title: Best Hotel in Bowling Green
data.text: I have family in Bowling Green and have stayed at most of the hotels there. This trip was a long trip to see everyone so we decided to stay at Staybridge. We are so thrilled we did. This hotel had everything we needed or could have wanted. It is extremely clean (unlike most). The staff makes you feel right at home. We will be back in December and will be staying at Staybridge again. Thank you for being our home away from home!

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel, we appreciate the great comments you made.  I am so glad our staff were able to make you feel right at home while visiting Bowling Green and we look forward to having you as our guest in December.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Just the best
data.text: I absolutely love this hotel, the Staybridge is by far the best place to stay in BG, it's always a treat to spend a couple nights here when working in BG! The staff are so friendly, the rooms are just huge and the facility overall is just very nice.

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. We are always glad to have you as our guest.  We look forward to having you back in the near future.  

Have a great day!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very comfortable hotel for both business or luxury travel !!
data.text:
I stayed in this hotel for around 2 weeks...I picked this hotel as it is close to many restaurants and grocery stores...They also provide free shuttle to limited areas....

If I travel again, I would definitely stay in this hotel as it has all facilities one looks for...a

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for choosing to stay at the Staybridge Suites on your extended visit to Bowling Green.  We appreciate your great review of our property and was glad to hear that your stay met your expectations.  Our location is a great choice and happy to hear that you were able to make use of the local amenities as well.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent Service and Great Location
data.text: This location was perfect for me as I was doing business at Western Kentucky University nearby.  The young lady who checked me in at the front desk was the friendliest person I've ever met.  I felt like family staying at a relative's house.  The room was spacious, extremely clean, and had every amenity I could ever need.  I stayed two nights during this visit.  There was a large assortment of options available at the free breakfast in the hotel.  Can't say enough good things about this hotel and my experience there.  Will definitely stay here again when I visit Bowling Green, KY again in 2017.

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the great review that you posted for us.  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay and was able to experience our staff friendliness.  We appreciate your great comments and our staff looks forward to seeing you again next year!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent Hotel/Highly Recommend
data.text: I highly recommend staying at the Staybridge Suites while either visiting Bowling Green, KY or just passing through.  The hotel is very nice and the staff is even nicer!! Check in was an absolute breeze and so was check out.  Beds slept great and I loved LOVED having a separate living area.  By the way the couch in the living area slept great as well!!

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review of our property.  We are so glad to see you enjoyed your stay and received great customer service while being our guest.  Being an all suite property is one of our great amenities and was thrilled to see you enjoyed having the privacy within your suite.  We look forward to having you back as our guest if you are ever in the Bowling Green area again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hotel!  Friendly staff and nice accommodations
data.text: Good location.  Were greeted with freshly popped popcorn and pink lemonade in lobby.  Wonderful 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite.  Real doors from bedrooms for privacy.  Excellently furnished kitchen and living room.  Did not need anything not provided! Very comfortable beds.  Good exercise area and clean pool.  Abundant parking and use of next door lot for large vehicles or trailers.  Good breakfast most days but skip the afternoon social hour- food not good and too many kids touching it.    Need larger trash can in the kitchen of room.  Ask for daily maid service.

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review of our hotel.  I am pleased to hear that our two bedroom suite worked well for your family.  I am glad you enjoyed the arrival amenities and our breakfast.  Thank you for the feedback as we will use the comments to better our service.  We hope that you will visit with us again soon.  

Sincerely,

Morgan S.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice hotel
data.text: My husband was there on business myself and our kids joined him. Hotel was nice staff was friendly. Rooms were good size. Pool was nice clean area but no need for it to be heated. breakfast was good nice selection and area was clean.

owner_response.author: Morgan S, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. I am so happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  Cleanliness and Friendliness is something we take great pride in and was pleased to hear that you experienced both from our staff. We hope you will visit us again.

Sincerely,

Morgan S
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Horrible!
data.text: To begin, I have never written a negative review, but here goes.  This motel looked wonderful when we drove up, but looks can be deceiving. Apparently, this hotel has a very low charge for pets, so watch out if you don't appreciate hearing dogs barking or staying at a hotel that smells of dogs.  We heard dogs barking in rooms, running down the hall with kids, even walked past a door propped open and blocked with a baby gate to keep a dog in.  Dogs are welcome in every room in the motel too.  Enough is enough!  We have stayed at many Staybridge Suites and have never experienced this.  This motel felt more like an overpriced kennel than one that is concerned about its guests.  Also, be prepared to have the fire alarm blast in your room, even if you are not cooking. This is a first too but was told to expect it to happen again. Must be that the guests there can't cook very well. Another first, very annoying situation!  Will I stay at another Staybridge Suites in the future?  Probably, but I will never stay this particular hotel ever again. Truly the most disappointing place I have ever overpaid for.

owner_response.author: Zoe P, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I want to apologize for the issues that you experienced while staying at our property.  The complications that happened during your stay are not typical of the service level we provide and I apologize that we did not meet your expectations.  I hope that you would allow us another chance and make use of the complimentary Gift Certificate voucher that we mailed to you.  Please do not hesitate to contact me personally.  

Morgan Staley 
270-904-0480
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Find in Bowling Green
data.text: Received call from desk clerk to confirm our reservation.....surprised to learn we had been upgraded to a two bedroom suite! It's HUGE! Perks include free wifi, free dinner buffet with salad bar (tonight's fare was meatball sliders, salad bar, choc chip cookies, and beverages), free breakfast buffet, large dining area, large hospitality area, beautiful courtyard and pool, guest laundry and fitness area. Why didn't I know about this place sooner?! Very reasonably priced, beautiful decor (think it was just recently built), full kitchen.....I think we'll move in! Kudos to Staybridge Suites!

data.title: Staybridge Bowling Green KY
data.text: Nice clean hotel. Service and staff was good. Breakfast was your normal fest, although they did have pizza for breakfast. Ok room was very nice and big kitchen they had it all frig, microwave, ice maker in freezer. The only fall back the beds where ok not the best, on the comfort end of things.

owner_response.author: Zoe P, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We hope you will visit us again. 

Sincerely,
Zoe P
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hotel, nice staff, clean and tidy
data.text:
Stayed in Bowling Green for a long weekend with the family. There was a small hiccup on checkin regarding a room that they had us in vs. what we'd reserved but it was quickly corrected.  We had a one bedroom suite with a pull out couch.  Suite was plenty big for us three, and the kitchen and fridge were a great addition and made things easy for leftovers, drinks, etc.  

Continental breakfast was very nice, and our daughter loved that there was a soda machine.  Ice was available too, and the waffles were a hit.  The pool was just big enough for all the kids there, and there was a pavilion with shade and a grill too.  

Would definitely stay again - in the the middle of a number of restaurants and not far from the mall or Target, and right next to the campus.

data.title: Great price, service and room.
data.text: We rented a 2 bedroom suite with full kitchen for a two night family stay.  The staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and large.  The pool area was very clean.  Had one day where there were no towels stocked at the pool, but front desk staff gave us towels to use.  The hot breakfast was well stocked and delicious.  Staff was very quick to answer any and all requests.  Overall a really good stay.  I would definitely stay here again.

data.title: Very indifferent due to indifferent staff
data.text:
This is certainly one of the toughest I've have to write. As those of you that may follow me know that I am extremely fair in my options whether I stayed for free or whether it be family owned. I call it like I see it.
Soooo, again, from the guy that stays in approx 30 different hotels a yr all over this country...... STAYBRIDGE SUITES 680 Campbell lane Bowling Green is a very clean and very new place (2010 build). All the amenities are true and accurate for the most part. Though I didn't use the pool I noted it was used quite frequently. My only issue with an amenity was the power exercise bike is electronic and did not work properly. It was, is, broke.
For such a new place, like most hotels, the tub is backed up with the usual ??????. Ugh! So was the sink. No biggie, we are all used to that but not usually in a newer place. My issue and reason for a 3 star rating? A portion of the staff. STAY AWAY from the 1st floor closest the pharmacy, though this same house maid may cover the whole first. For what ever reason, she IS MISERABLE! Even so I tipped her every day. She obviously got complacent with the tips as the room was getting dirtier and dirtier to the point where it was not cleaned at all. I had no choice after nine days to ask for my garbage to be dumped, resupply toilet paper and change my bed sheets, resupply towels, etc...With those statements made to management, the head housekeeper brought that specific maid to my room which obviously made things much worse. It is obvious that this maid has been there much longer than the head housekeeper, who did nothing to resolve the problems. In short, the problems just got worse. So now, naturally,have not been tipping. Than the phone calls started. Keep in mind that these phone calls must come from an internal source as all outside calls must go through the front desk. My calls were from AA. I keep a case of beer in my room and I guess that's all this old miserable maid could come up with. She obviously wasn't too bright as both calls were made before 7 PM. That's all it took for me to unplug both phones. Problem solved! I could go on and on as the situations spread to some young attitude at the front desk that obviously was scared of the same maid.....or was friends with her as their personalities seemed to be identical. So long story shortened......., after 12 days I switched rooms to the second floor where I commenced to tip that HOUSEKEEPER much much more just for spite. I hope that maid on the first floor reads this and takes note of what personal actions can cost if those personal issues are brought to work and taken out on the very people that pay your bills. 
So would I stay there again? The answer is yes as 80% of the people were very nice as was maintenance when I called to have my ice maker fixed. 
In closing, just stay away from the first floor pharmacy side. Good luck and enjoy the free dinners every MON, Tues and Wed night.

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear kodiakcj,
 
Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, KY. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate your nice comment about the amenities.

However, we’re sorry we fell below your expectation regarding housekeeping. We will address this concerns. We take all reviews positive and negative very seriously, and your feedback will help us improve for our next guest or your next visit.
 
Sincerely, 
 
Orlando A. 
Case Manager 
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent rooms, great staff
data.text: Had to stay there because of major reconstruction at my house. It was great, wonderful helpful staff, comfortable rooms and beds. The suites have everything that you want from home, but with maid service!  I rather wonder why I moved back to my house...

owner_response.author: Zoe P, General Manager at Staybridge Suites Bowling Green, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We hope you will visit us again. 

Sincerely,

Zoe P
General Manager
